lines.Line: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent’sNEWLINEanniversary party
Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners
Oooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers? (Sits up) Who saidNEWLINEthat
Yeah, he’s really great though. He has this incredible zest forNEWLINElife, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughtyNEWLINEgirl I am
(To Ross) Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to momNEWLINEand dad this year
(To Ross) Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to momNEWLINEand dad this year
Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20<sup>th</sup>
Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you
Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you
Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it’s always reallyNEWLINEmoving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I’m going to make them cry
And you wonder why Ross is their favorite
And you wonder why Ross is their favorite

No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him,NEWLINEand pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, God, yourNEWLINEbrother. Know what they’ll say this year? God, yo
Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying. (Points toNEWLINEhimself) I’m an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue. (snaps fingers
Are you kidding me? Watch! (Makes funny faces trying to cry) Well INEWLINEcan’t do it with you guys watching me

2.SceneDescription: The Anniversary Party, Ross and Rachel are arriving and see his parents.

lines.Line: This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys haveNEWLINEany pearls of wisdom?
Why would you serve food on such a sharp stick? (Looking aNEWLINEtoothpick
That’s a good question, dad. That’s a good question
That’s a good question, dad. That’s a good question
(To Ross and Rachel) Congratulations you two
And also, congratulations on your wedding

Can we talk to you for just a y’know… It’s just aNEWLINElittle thing. Well we think it’s absolutely marvelous that you’re having thisNEWLINEbaby out of wedlock, some of our friends are less open-minded. Which is why we’veNEWLINEtold them all that you’re married
Thanks for going along with this
Thanks for going along with this
Dad so what we have to pretend that we’re married
Son, I had to shave my ears for tonight. You can do this
Yeah, if you’re going to do the ears, you might as well take a passNEWLINEat the nosal area
No, us having to lie about being married
No, us having to lie about being married

No, I know I don’t either, but ya know what, it’s their party,NEWLINEand it’s just one night. And we don’t even have to lie; we just won’t sayNEWLINEanything. If it comes up again, we’ll just…smile. We’ll nod along
Congratulations on the baby, and on the weddin
Here’s a little something to get you started. (Hands them aNEWLINEcheck
So, how’s married life treating you

lines.Character: (The rest of the gang arrives including Parker
lines.Line: The rest of the gang arrives including Parker.

What a beautiful place. What a great night! I have to tell you, beingNEWLINEhere with all of you in Event Room C…I feel so lucky. I think of all the good timesNEWLINEthat have happened here. The birthdays, the proms, the mitzvahs both bar and bat, but noneNEWLINEof them will compare with tonight! My God, I don’t want to forget this moment!NEWLINEIt’s like I want to take a mental picture of you all! Click! (He takes a mentalNEWLINEpicture of them all.
I don’t think the flash went off
I don’t think the flash went off
Dahaaa! (Punches Chandler in the arm and he makes a face of pain.)NEWLINEI’m going to find the men’s room, be right back
Somewhere there is someone with a tranquilizer gun and a hugeNEWLINEbutterfly net looking for that man
I have to go to the bathroom too, but I don’t want him complimentingNEWLINEmy thing
I’m so we weren’t in the car! Did he ever let up
I’m so we weren’t in the car! Did he ever let up
He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle
He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle

(imitating Parker) This room! This night! That waiter! His shoes! I mustNEWLINEtake a mental picture! (He backs into someone.) Ooh sorry…(He looks behind him thenNEWLINEnotices its Phoebe then stops his impression.
Were you guys making fun of Parker
Were you guys making fun of Parker
That depends, how much did you hear
That depends, how much did you hear
So, he a little enthusiastic, what’s wrong with that
It’s just that, it’s so much
It’s just that, it’s so much

Well, so what I like him! Do I make fun of the people you’ve dated?NEWLINETag, Janice, Mona? No, because friends don’t do that. But, do you want my opinion? DoNEWLINEyou want it? ‘Cause in my opinion, your collective dating record reads like theNEWLINEwho’s who of human crap. (Walks off

3.SceneDescription: Phoebe’s apartment, Parker and her are entering.

lines.Line: My God what a fantastically well lit hallway
Can I get you something to drink? Like a water and Valium?
I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words
I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words
It’s a haven. A third-floor paradise. A modern-day Eden in theNEWLINEmidst
Yeah? I know! I know! Uh huh? Listen why don’t we just um, sit andNEWLINErelax? You know just be with each other. Quietly!
That sounds great. (Sits down) My God this is the most comfortable couchNEWLINEI’ve ever sat on in my entire life. (Bounces on couch
Let’s try something else, let’s play a game
Let’s try something else, let’s play a game
Let’s try something else, let’s play a game
Shocking! Let’s play the game of who can stay quiet the longest.NEWLINE(Giggles
But, let’s play this one first. And remember whoever talks firstNEWLINEloses!
Oh my God! Oh my God!
Oh my God! Oh my God!

Wrong? Really? You know the word wrong. Everything isn’t perfect?NEWLINEEverything isn’t magical? Everything isn’t a glow with the light of a millionNEWLINEfairies? They were just brake lights, Parker!
Well, excuse me for putting a good spin on a traffic jam
You don’t have to put a good spin on everything
You don’t have to put a good spin on everything
I’m sorry that’s who I am. I’m a positive person
I’m sorry that’s who I am. I’m a positive person
No! I am a positive person. You are like Santa Clause on Prozac, at Disneyland,NEWLINEgetting laid!
So what do you want me to do, you want me to be more negative, lessNEWLINEhappy
Fine! Well then to quote Ross, I’d better be going.
So long! Don’t let the best door in the world hit you in the ass onNEWLINEyour way out! (He exits and she slams the door behind him.

lines.Character: (There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it
lines.Line: There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it.

lines.Character: (There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it
lines.Line: There’s a knock on door, and Phoebe opens it.
Isn’t this the most incredible fight you’ve ever had in yourNEWLINEentire life?

4.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Ross and Monica are there.

lines.Line: Okay that’s it. I give up. At mom and dad’s 40<sup>th</sup>NEWLINEanniversary, you’re the one giving the speech.
Y’know I don’t understand why they didn’t cry. It was aNEWLINEbeautiful speech.

Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, weNEWLINEdid learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin.NEWLINEAnd what you said about Nana. Ohh, yeah she really would’ve wanted to be there. AndNEWLINEyou know what? I think she was.
(starts to cry) Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?
(starts to cry) Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?
